rev.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/71.7.84.250|71.7.84.250]] identified as [[WP:VAND|vandalism]] to last revision by [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. using [[WP:TW|TW]]
rev.diff:
Line 8: Line 8:
Antiquity offers numerous examples of what may readily be described as cults of thanatophilia; perhaps the most famous of them being that of [[Alexander the Great]]'s, which was physically centered around his [[breastplate]], kept in a [[mausoleum|mausolean]] reliquary in the [[eponymous]] Egyptian city for over five hundred years. More remarkable still are accounts stating that Alexander's body was placed in a [[sarcophagus]] of solid gold and perfectly preserved in a (sterilizing) bath of honey through the remaining centuries of antiquity.
Antiquity offers numerous examples of what may readily be described as cults of thanatophilia; perhaps the most famous of them being that of [[Alexander the Great]]'s, which was physically centered around his [[breastplate]], kept in a [[mausoleum|mausolean]] reliquary in the [[eponymous]] Egyptian city for over five hundred years. More remarkable still are accounts stating that Alexander's body was placed in a [[sarcophagus]] of solid gold and perfectly preserved in a (sterilizing) bath of honey through the remaining centuries of antiquity.

It means that your Grandma was good last night
